alert.note: Alert for Emery (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 2:49PM MDT until August 18 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Trail Mountain burn scar along SR-31 in... Northwestern Emery County in central Utah... * Until 545 PM MDT. * At 249 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.5 inches are possible in the upper portions of the Trail Mountain drainage. Flash flooding and/or a debris flow is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. moving through the Trail Mountain burn scar and potentially onto SR- HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Trail Mountain Burn Scar and adjacent portions of SR-31. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Emery County along SR-31 adjacent to Trail Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Trail Mountain Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
